column2: snp, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My doctor prescribed this drug for lung congestion due to a severe cold. After taking the med for about 1 day I felt soooo much better! I commented to my coworkers that I hadn't felt so bodily pain free in about 2 years. I was unaware at the time that Methylprednisolone was also helpful in easing joint pain around elbows, wrists and generally the entire body. I have fibromyalgia and had not yet gone on the webmd website to research the medication. Not only did it clear the congestion around the lungs but it made me feel better than the meds I am currently using for fibromyalgia. The only drawback to the drug which I have read in user comments was hot flashes which came and went. Truthfully though, to be pain free for a few days was very well worth it! Will be asking my doctor if I can perhaps get off the current meds I take and go on some kind of Medrol.

column2: dgable, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had two swollen knees(worn cartilage in left & torn meniscus in right one) and sore shoulders from overuse in my job as a wrestling coach. Also, my three patches of psoriasis dried up almost completely, and to top it off, I had my best weight workout in years...able to do two sets of 20+ pull ups, which was about a 20% improvement.  It does ramp up the blood pressure and metabolism quite profoundly, so a good idea to engage in intensive exercise of some kind to take the edge off. Truly a wonder drug in the short term.

45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Was put on it in 2008 for assumed asthma problems.  7 hours into my first days dose I became profusely diaphoretic, swollen tongue, migraine headache. Doc told me to stop taking it and I actually felt better until the middle of the night.  Woke up felt like my heart had stopped and lungs were not functioning properly. jumped out of bed took one breath and went into what is called an SVT rhythm which I sustained for an extended period thanks to the medrol already in my system.  Had serious after effects from that alone, for weeks! Cardiac labs all elevated and am now with permanent arrythmia problems of many types including SVT and on cardiac meds indefinitely. I was 46 years old when that happened.  Gave the info to the manufacturer and they did nothing about giving me info back, like numbers of others with the same problem.  No help whatsoever!  Shame on the those who monitor this business!  I Never had any of these symptoms before taking this med.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: cleared my rash in days...

column2: Bronch Buster, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: In 1982 I had been taking Predisone for bronchits for several years, I began Medrol because prednisone wasn't controlling the bronchial problems well. I am diagnosed with COPD. Moderate then, moderate - severe now. I have been on O2 now for 3 years. I still choose to work 3 hrs. a day. Without the Medrol I doubt I'd be alive now. The side effects are troublesome, but the alternative is worse for me. There is edema and low immune factors that are also treated now, likely related to the steroids. Still worth the toll it has taken. Learning how to boost when necessary and then judge day by day how fast to reduce the dose came easily when I was younger. Now, at 62, I find that the drug seems to stay in my system longer. I am able to skip a day several times a month. All my oral medications clear more slowly now and my blood pressure med (Prinivil) is now at a 2.5 mg dose every other day. I record my medrol dose daily, and monitor my BP twice a day. I also have a spectrum of 3 antibiotics available at home for use when I get a flare-up of the bronchitis.

I just wish I could continue on it or, as I said, wish it had MORE lost lasing healing effect along with the pain relief it gives so that after you've been on it for a limited time you could come off it and the problem would be healed or mostly healed.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have Rheumatoid Arthritis and my hand and feet were very inflamed and the pain was so bad I would cry everyday. I hated waking up in the morning because my ankles and feet hurt to walk and my hands were so stiff and painful I could not even put toothpaste on my toothbrush or get ready without pain.My shoulder was also hurting to where I could not pick up my arm wtihout pain so I was prescribed physical therapy but that has improved also. I felt so much better after the first day of taking the 4mg dosepak. I am just wondering how long it will last after I complete the 6 day treatment. I am worried about the longterm side affects and liver damage.Right now I am also on my second treatment of Rimicade but it has not done anything for me yet.

column2: michbar, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had terrible heel soreness for a year, and no dr. could figure out what the problem was and how to treat it.  Finally, a new podiatrist told me to "test" the medrol.  After 2-3 days -- my heels are almost normal again!  It has really been a miracle!  Finally!

column2: bill, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed this medication in the ER for treatment of pericarditis (inflamation around the heart). I am a non insulin diabetic. Immediately after starting this medication my blood sugar levels increased dramatically from normal around 120 to over 300. I also experienced dizziness and stomach upset. I am now on third day of Medrol dose pack and have contacted my doctor about stoppong medication. I should also mention that the pericarditis symptoms had dissapeared before I started on the Medrol so I have seen no specific benefits - only problems.
